job description:
Associate Director Neuroscience Scientist
Clinical-stage, public biotech company in north Cambridge impacting life-altering diseases through novel immunology therapeutics is hiring an Associate Director of Neuroscience / CNS to lead us into new CNS-related, neuroscientific and/or neurodegenerative disease therapeutics through research-driven strategy around target validation. This is a new, direct-hire position created due to company growth.

What You Need for this Position
  • Ph.D. in Neuroscience or closely related subject
  • 5+ years' overall academic or industry experience after completing a Ph.D.
  • Proven experience leading neuro-related research projects, ideally in target validation for preclinical programs
  • Expertise in establishing and executing in vitro and in vivo studies
  • Expertise in cell biology, biochemical and/or cellular assay development, and/or establishment of primary and/or iPSC-derived neuronal cultures.
What You Will Be Doing
We have had great success in multiple therapeutic indications (hematology, autoimmune neuromuscular, renal, and more) through our complement system-focused programs, and we would like to expand into more neuroscientific and/or neurodegenerative diseases. That's where you come in!
  • Approx. 70% bench work (or bench-related work while our CROs implement the experiments)
  • Create a research strategy to generate foundational data supporting target validation
  • Design and help execute in vitro and in vivo studies
  • Coordinate experiments and analysis with CROs as needed
  • Present findings to executive-level staff
  • Develop collaborative networks
  • Lead one or more bench scientists as the company expands
Reports to: Head of Discovery Biology

Top Reasons to Work with Us
  • 5 diverse programs in our pipeline with 2 already in phase II!
  • Research-focused management "willing to use never before seen technology"
  • Patient-focused company valuing regulatory and quality compliance in order to best serve patients
What's In It for You
  • Paid parking in Cambridge
  • Public transit assistance
  • Relocation Assistance
  • Competitive Salary
  • Stock Options
  • Great Benefits
  • Generous PTO/Vacation
  • Advancement Opportunities
  • Paid Holidays
  • Summer Schedule
  • Company Luncheons
  • Top-Rated Office Culture with Very Low Turnover
Don't miss out, please apply today!
  • Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
